column4: I just bought this Intel SRCS28X serial ATA raid controller to drop in my ubuntu file server, and I found that the card doesn't fit in my PCI slot.  The card is PCI-X but backwards compatitable with 32-bit PCI
my friend told me that it works in older PCI slots if you turn it around...is that true?
can someone help me?  Is it possible to get a PCI-X card into a PCI slot by turning it around?
